case_title: Hay INAYATULLAH vs ADDITIONAL COMMISSIONER, HYDERABAD and another
complaint_summary: The petitioner filed a revision petition against the order of the Additional Commissioner, Hyderabad, rejecting his appeal concerning the cancellation of land grant in Deh Akaro, Taluka Tando Bago.
investigation_summary: The cancellation of the land grant was based on the recommendation of the M.F.R.O. without issuing notice to the petitioner. The land was granted to the petitioner since 1964, with some installments paid, and is mostly under water.
judgment_summary: The court allowed the revision petition, restored the disputed land to the petitioner, and directed him to bring the land under cultivation and fulfill all conditions of the grant.
Decision_or_verdict: Revision petition allowed; land restored to petitioner.
legal_arguments: Cancellation of land grant was done without issuing notice to the petitioner.
Land grant has been in effect since 1964 with partial payments made.

assets.description: 32-00 Acres of land in Deh Akaro, Taluka Tando Bago

witness_statement.Revenue Officer, Kotri Barrage, Hyderaba: Executed cancellation based on M.F.R.O.'s recommendation.

key_issues: Whether the cancellation of the land grant was lawful.
Whether the petitioner was given due notice before cancellation.

legal_terms.Revision Petition: A legal request to review a decision made by a lower authority.
legal_terms.Grant: A legal transfer of property or rights.

words_and_phrases.Under cultivation: Efforts to make land suitable for farming.
words_and_phrases.Grant ressred: Restoration of the grant to the petitioner.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around a land grant dispute where the petitioner challenged the cancellation of his land grant without notice. The court restored the land to the petitioner, emphasizing procedural fairness and compliance with grant conditions.
